p: In the radial arm maze task, two-way ANOVA analysis revealed major changes among the groups for both working memory performance (F(18, 112) = 43.98, p < 0.0001) ( Figure 7C), as well as for reference memory performance (F(18, 112) = 9.29, p < 0.0001) ( Figure 7D). As compared to the control group (I), the evaluation of the pretreated Aβ1-42 animals (II) was characterized by significant increments regarding the number of working memory errors ( p < 0.0001) ( Figure 7C), as well as the number of reference memory errors ( p < 0.0001) ( Figure 7D), proving that the single Aβ1-42 administration impaired the spatial memory. The inhaled OmEO in both concentrations (III and IV) determined a significant reduction of working memory errors in pretreated Aβ1-42 animals ( p < 0.0001) ( Figure 7C). On the other hand, reference memory acquisition was enhanced only in Aβ1-42 pretreated animals that inhaled 1%OmEO (III) ( p = 0.0142) ( Figure 7D). The inhalation of 3%OmEO (IV) did not improve the reference memory performance in Aβ1-42 pretreated animals ( p = 0.9717) ( Figure 7D).
